com.dev.yvgenijsharovskij.n5kanjiandkanjistoryquiz.kanjilist

Class KanjiZoomDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v4.app.Fragment
      • android.support.v4.app.DialogFragment
        • com.dev.yvgenijsharovskij.n5kanjiandkanjistoryquiz.util.CustomDialogFragment
          • com.dev.yvgenijsharovskij.n5kanjiandkanjistoryquiz.kanjilist.KanjiZoomDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.arch.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, android.arch.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.DialogInterface.OnCancelListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener

    public class KanjiZoomDialog
extends CustomDialogFragment
    This class shows the kanji from KanjiFragment class when the users taps on the kanji TextView. Extends the CustomDialogFragment class to show an AlertDialog with a "Dismiss" action button.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Yvgenij Sharovskij
    See Also:
    CustomDialogFragment

      • newInstance

        public static KanjiZoomDialog newInstance(java.util.UUID kanjiId)
        Starts a new instance of KanjiZoomDialog, called in the parent activity. Accepts a UUID, creates a new fragment instance with the Bundle argument kanjiId, and then attaches the argument(s) to the fragment.
        Parameters:
        kanjiId - The kanji UUID.
        Returns:
        fragment an instance of the KanjiFragment

      • onSaveInstanceState

        public void onSaveInstanceState(@NonNull
                                android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Called to ask the fragment to save its current dynamic state, so it can later be reconstructed in a new instance of its process. If a new instance of the fragment later needs to be created, the data placed in the Bundle here will be available in the Bundle given to onCreate(Bundle), onCreateView(LayoutInflater, ViewGroup, Bundle), and onActivityCreated(Bundle).
        Note: this method may be called at any time before onDestroy().
        Overrides:
        onSaveInstanceState in class android.support.v4.app.DialogFragment
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - Bundle in which to place the saved state.
